intro: Sisymbrium sagittatum var. commune, commonly known as the common shepherd's purse, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive triangular seed pods, which are often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with alternate, pinnately lobed leaves. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. The flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in racemes, blooming from late spring to early autumn.
